whatTheyOffer: CASARC serves children and adolescents (for children 6-17 yrs) who have been sexually or physically abused or who have witnessed violence. CASARC has specially trained clinical psychologists who will help you identify ways the trauma has affected you and your family and will assist you in recovering from the negative impacts of the abuse. Individual, group, and family interventions are available. Services include - Individual and family psychotherapy, parenting skills and education, and psychiat
howToGetIt: - During business hours: you can speak with a CASARC intake nurse. - After business hours: a CASARC nurse will return your call as soon as possible. Phone: (628) 206-8386
cost: There is no charge for crisis intervention and referral, either by phone or in person. There is no charge for the emergency medical exam following sexual assault.
agency: Child and Adolescent Support, Advocacy & Resource Center (CASARC) SFGH
